page.title: 15WEARDALE: HEALTH RISKS
page.content:
People in St Johns Chapel and Westgate are worried about the proposal to close the ambulance station at weekends.It is open on week days but if you have an accident at the weekend you might have to wait until an ambulance comes from Crook which is 20 miles away . Then there is an extra journey to Bishop Auckland Hospital which is 26 miles away. { Weadale might be chosen by the {Goverment to bury nuclear waste {because of the very deep lead mines in {the area. They could bring over 1 {million tonnes of nuclear waste in the {next 15 years.The people are concerned {because they fear it might pollute the {water and cause diseases like cancer.
The local people have formed action groups to fight both of these possibilities.
